April 12, 1958
Dear Burton:
Why do your letters always arrive so I have to answer
them on Saturday mornings? Only kidding.
Be: JC®T memo.
Your or someone has un&erlined/sentenee on page 3»
I think the primary functions of JuE T should not be changed.
What I believe the sentence should say (and may have actually
meant to say) is that JCET*s major efforts at this time should
be in this direction. In any event, I etc not believe primary
function or functions of JCET should be changed, if a major
effort is to be made in direction Indicated by memo, this is
an ffort that still falls under primary purpose.
Over-all, I see this danger, or raise the question
of danger. If such action or actions are taken by JCET, would
this not throw open the door for wide-open modification of the
Sixth Report and Order? This seems to me a dangerous thing.
Tills seems to open door for other parties to join in at the
time of JCET requested hearing and give the commercial boys
(those same boys who were caught sleep at the switch on
orlglanl JCET efforts, hearings and subsequent FCC actions on
ETV reservations). I doubt if this is worth the risk.
I am aware that Sixth Report and Order Is being
dissemated by Individual actions. An open invitation to toss
it out Is dangerous, seems to me.
On other hand, I think JCET might proceed with the
purpose, and not open wide the doors. For example, seek first
and. foremost to help in Detroit and Rochester areas. I agree
that ETV is needed In more and larger metropolitan areas.
In other words, I think it is a matter of procedure
and tactics. The goal of ETV for NYC, for example, is good for
JCET and others to have. What have the NY Interest done? Not
fought for ETV what chances were best. So we have the WOR
episode. Maybe It could not have been otherwise.
Don't know that I've been helpful, but these are my
comments at this hour.
Regards
